EXSLTRegexpMatch.summary: regexp:match() performs regular expression matching on a string, returning the submatches found as a result.
EXSLTRegexpMatch.returns: A node set of match elements, each of which has the string value equal to a portion of the first parameter string as captured by the regular expression. If the match isn't a global one, the first match element has the value of the portion of the string matched by the entire regular expression.For example:This code generates the following output:
